p: The global ecology of avian influenza, is summarized in Figure 1 along with various polymorphic strains. It has been established that migratory waterfowl, especially anseriformes and charadrillformes, play a central role in the global ecology [ 7, 8]. Moreover, migratory waterfowl have been implicated as natural reservoirs, mixing vessels, and intercontinental vectors for various serotypes of avian viruses [ 8]. Unfortunately, knowledge on global spread of H5N1 is rather limited [ 9] with ongoing debates regarding its transmission pathways [ 8, 10].
